column3: description

A collaborative web-based design and prototyping tool that allows teams to create, test, and share user interface designs in real-time. It streamlines the design-to-development process with features for vector editing, interactive prototyping, and developer handoff, ensuring consistency across web and mobile applications.

A data preparation and analytics platform that enables users to blend, clean, and analyze data from multiple sources without requiring coding skills. Designer offers a visual drag-and-drop interface for building analytics workflows, performing statistical analysis, and creating predictive models.

An open-source web-based notebook platform that enables interactive data exploration, visualization, and collaboration. Zeppelin supports multiple programming languages including Python, Scala, R, and SQL, allowing data scientists and analysts to create shareable documents that combine code, visualizations, and narrative text.

A Git-based version control and code collaboration platform designed for software development teams. Bitbucket provides source code management, pull request workflows, continuous integration pipelines, and deployment capabilities, enabling development teams to collaborate on code and manage software release processes.

A developer experience platform that helps engineering teams track distributed software architecture and manage metadata, components, and dependencies. It provides a unified component catalog and health scorecards to improve visibility, compliance, and operational readiness across complex microservices environments.

A project management and issue tracking platform used for agile software development and project coordination. Jira enables teams to plan, track, and release software projects using customizable workflows, sprint planning tools, reporting dashboards, and integration with development tools.

cloud-based Enterprise Agile Planning (EAP) platform that connects business strategy with technical execution. It aggregates team-level data to provide real-time visibility across the enterprise, enabling organizations to scale agile practices, align portfolios with strategic goals, and optimize value delivery across complex development environments.

A product management tool designed to help teams capture, prioritize, and collaborate on product ideas and roadmaps directly within Jira. It enables product managers to gather insights, link ideas to development tasks, and transparently communicate product strategy to stakeholders.

A high-performance, fully managed relational database engine compatible with MySQL, built for the cloud to deliver the speed of high-end commercial databases with the cost-effectiveness of open source. It features auto-scaling storage, replication across availability zones, and serverless options for unpredictable workloads.

A fully managed PostgreSQL-compatible database engine that offers high availability and durability by automatically replicating data six times across three availability zones. It optimizes performance for demanding applications and integrates seamlessly with other AWS services for monitoring, security, and machine learning.

A monitoring and observability service that provides data and actionable insights for AWS resources and applications. It collects logs, metrics, and events to help users detect anomalies, visualize performance with dashboards, and automate actions to optimize operational health and resource utilization.

A serverless, NoSQL key-value database designed for high-scale applications requiring single-digit millisecond performance. It offers built-in security, continuous backups, and automated multi-region replication, making it ideal for mobile, web, gaming, and IoT applications handling massive amounts of data.

A web service that provides secure, resizable compute capacity in the cloud, allowing users to launch virtual servers (instances) tailored to specific workloads. It offers a wide variety of processor, storage, and networking options to support everything from general-purpose applications to high-performance computing.

A serverless data integration service that makes it easy to discover, prepare, and combine data for analytics, machine learning, and application development. It includes features for ETL (extract, transform, and load) jobs, a data catalog for metadata management, and visual tools for building data pipelines.

A platform for collecting, processing, and analyzing real-time, streaming data such as video, audio, application logs, and website clickstreams. It enables applications to respond instantly to incoming data streams, supporting use cases like live video analytics and real-time dashboarding.

A fully managed service that makes it easy to deploy, secure, and operate OpenSearch clusters for log analytics, application monitoring, and full-text search. It supports visualization through OpenSearch Dashboards and integrates with other AWS services to ingest and analyze high volumes of data securely.

A fully managed, petabyte-scale cloud data warehouse that uses SQL to analyze structured and semi-structured data across data warehouses, operational databases, and data lakes. It delivers fast query performance using columnar storage, massive parallel processing, and machine learning-based optimization.

A collection of managed services that simplifies setting up, operating, and scaling databases in the cloud. It supports multiple database engines—including Amazon Aurora, PostgreSQL, MySQL, MariaDB, Oracle, and SQL Server—handling routine tasks like hardware provisioning, database setup, patching, and backups.

A data lake analytics platform deployed on Amazon EKS that allows users to run fast, interactive SQL queries across distributed data sources without moving data. It provides a single point of access to query data in data lakes, warehouses, and streaming systems with enterprise-grade security and performance.

An object storage service offering industry-leading scalability, data availability, security, and performance. It allows customers of all sizes to store and protect any amount of data for a range of use cases, such as data lakes, websites, mobile applications, backup and restore, archive, and big data analytics.

A fully managed relational database with built-in intelligence that supports self-driving features such as performance tuning and threat monitoring. It offers high availability, automated backups, and scalability with near-zero downtime, making it suitable for a wide range of cloud applications.

A Unix shell and command language used for automating tasks, managing system configurations, and executing command-line instructions. It is the default shell on most Linux distributions and macOS, widely used by developers and system administrators for scripting and pipeline orchestration.

A Power BI external tool that analyzes reports and datasets to identify unused measures and columns. It helps developers clean up their data models by providing a clear overview of dependencies, optimizing performance and reducing file size.

A modern, object-oriented programming language developed by Microsoft as part of the .NET initiative. It is widely used for building Windows desktop applications, web services, enterprise software, and games, offering strong type safety and component-oriented programming features.

A data integration tool that enables seamless connectivity between Salesforce and SQL Server. It allows users to write SQL to access Salesforce data in real-time or replicate it locally for reporting, analytics, and data warehousing purposes.

A large collection of GNU and Open Source tools which provide functionality similar to a Linux distribution on Windows. It includes a DLL (Dynamic Link Library) that acts as a POSIX emulation layer, allowing users to run Linux applications and scripts natively on Windows systems.

The governance layer for the Databricks Lakehouse Platform (Unity Catalog) that provides centralized access control, auditing, lineage, and data discovery across all data and AI assets. It enables secure sharing of data and models while ensuring compliance with enterprise standards.

The computational engine of the Databricks platform that manages the lifecycle of clusters for data engineering, data science, and analytics workloads. It provides scalable, auto-terminating clusters and serverless options to optimize performance and cost for processing large datasets.

A SQL-based analytics environment within Databricks (Databricks SQL) that allows analysts to run queries, create visualizations, and build interactive dashboards directly on the Lakehouse. It offers a familiar SQL editor and integrates with BI tools like Tableau and Power BI.

A comprehensive machine learning environment (Mosaic AI) that spans the full ML lifecycle from data preparation to model deployment. It includes managed MLflow for experiment tracking, model registry for versioning, and feature store for managing model features, along with AutoML capabilities.

A collaborative, web-based interface for data science and engineering teams to write code, visualize data, and share insights. It supports multiple languages (Python, SQL, Scala, R) within the same environment and integrates with version control systems for robust development workflows.

A fully managed orchestration service that allows users to schedule, run, and monitor data processing jobs and machine learning pipelines. It ensures reliability with features like automatic retries, alerting, and dependency management for complex workflows.

A centralized data platform that democratizes access to data and enables organizations to build independent AI and analytics applications. It offers a visual, team-based interface for data preparation, machine learning, and deployment, catering to both coders and non-coders.

A tool for executing and analyzing DAX queries against Microsoft Tabular models, including Power BI and Analysis Services. It provides deep insights into query performance, helping developers optimize their data models and improve report rendering times.

A cloud-native integration platform as a service (iPaaS) that connects applications, data, and devices across hybrid IT environments. It simplifies the creation of data pipelines and workflow automations with a low-code, drag-and-drop interface.

A platform for developing, shipping, and running applications in isolated containers. It enables developers to package applications with all their dependencies, ensuring consistency across different development, testing, and production environments.

An open-source tool to analyze, monitor, and debug machine learning models in production. It generates interactive reports on data drift, target drift, and model performance, helping data scientists maintain the quality and reliability of their AI systems.

A comprehensive JavaScript charting library offering over 100 interactive charts and 2,000 maps. It allows developers to build complex, data-driven dashboards for web and mobile applications with consistent rendering across all devices and browsers.

A statically typed, compiled programming language designed by Google for simplicity, reliability, and efficiency. It is widely used for building scalable cloud services, microservices, and distributed systems due to its strong support for concurrency.

A service that converts addresses into geographic coordinates (latitude and longitude) and vice versa. It enables applications to place markers on a map or position the map based on user input, essential for location-based services.

A leading open-source tool for validating, documenting, and profiling data. It helps data teams maintain data quality by allowing them to define "expectations" (tests) for their data, which are automatically checked during data pipelines to prevent bad data from causing issues downstream.

An infrastructure-as-code software tool that enables users to define and provision data center infrastructure using a high-level configuration language. It allows teams to safely and predictably create, change, and improve infrastructure across multiple cloud providers.

A high-level, interpreted programming language that is a core technology of the World Wide Web. It enables interactive web pages and is an essential part of web applications, supporting event-driven, functional, and imperative programming styles.

An open-source web application that allows users to create and share documents that contain live code, equations, visualizations, and narrative text. It is a standard tool in data science for cleaning and transforming data, numerical simulation, statistical modeling, and machine learning.

A leading supply chain design and planning platform that uses AI and advanced analytics to help businesses model, optimize, and simulate their supply chain networks. It enables organizations to test "what-if" scenarios to balance cost, service, and risk.

A library for building stateful, multi-actor applications with LLMs, built on top of LangChain. It enables the creation of cyclical graphs often needed for agentic behaviors, allowing developers to build complex, reliable AI agents with memory and persistence.

A web-based diagramming application that allows users to collaborate visually on drawing, revising, and sharing charts and diagrams. It is widely used for creating process maps, flowcharts, org charts, and technical architectural diagrams.

A comprehensive privileged access management (PAM) solution for enterprise IT teams. It provides complete control over privileged accounts, helping to secure access to critical assets, monitor privileged sessions, and ensure compliance with security regulations.

A state-of-the-art platform for statistical modeling and high-performance statistical computation. It is used for Bayesian inference and optimization, allowing researchers and data scientists to specify complex statistical models and perform inference using advanced sampling algorithms.

A knowledge-driven data quality solution that enables data stewards to build a knowledge base for data correction and deduplication. It provides computer-assisted processes to cleanse and match data, ensuring high-quality information for business intelligence and data warehousing.

An AI-powered coding assistant that helps developers write code faster and with fewer errors. It suggests whole lines or blocks of code as you type, supporting multiple languages and frameworks, and acts as a pair programmer to improve productivity.

A suite of apps, services, and connectors that provides a rapid application development environment to build custom apps for business needs. It empowers users to create web and mobile apps without writing code, connecting to various data sources.

A service that helps users create automated workflows between desired applications and services to synchronize files, get notifications, and collect data. It streamlines repetitive tasks and business processes with a user-friendly, drag-and-drop interface.

A free application you install on your local computer that lets you connect to, transform, and visualize your data. It is the primary authoring tool for Power BI, enabling analysts to build robust data models and create interactive reports.

A self-service data preparation feature that allows users to create and manage data transformation logic in the cloud. Dataflows enable the reuse of data across multiple reports and datasets, promoting a standardized approach to ETL within the Power BI ecosystem.

An Azure service that enables developers to embed visual analytics and interactive reports into their own applications. It allows independent software vendors (ISVs) and developers to provide Power BI capabilities to their customers without requiring them to have Power BI licenses.

software that acts as a bridge between on-premises data (source) and cloud-based services like Power BI, Power Automate, and Azure Logic Apps. It ensures that data in the cloud is kept up-to-date with on-premise data sources securely and efficiently.

An enterprise-grade capacity license that provides dedicated resources for running Power BI service. It offers advanced features such as larger dataset sizes, more frequent refreshes, paginated reports, and AI capabilities, enabling organizations to scale analytics broadly.

A per-user license that allows modern BI users to publish reports, share dashboards, and collaborate with colleagues in workspaces. It is the standard license required for sharing content and consuming shared content within the Power BI service.

A licensing model for Microsoft SQL Server based on the number of CPU cores in the server. It is typically used for large-scale enterprise deployments, allowing unlimited user access and maximizing processing power for mission-critical database workloads.

A platform for building enterprise-level data integration and data transformation solutions. It features a rich set of built-in tasks and transformations for moving data, managing packages, and orchestrating complex ETL (Extract, Transform, Load) workflows.

An integrated environment for managing any SQL infrastructure, from SQL Server to Azure SQL Database. It provides tools to configure, monitor, and administer instances of SQL Server and databases, as well as to deploy, monitor, and upgrade the data-tier components.

A lightweight but powerful source code editor which runs on your desktop and is available for Windows, macOS, and Linux. It comes with built-in support for JavaScript, TypeScript and Node.js and has a rich ecosystem of extensions for other languages and runtimes.

A comprehensive integrated development environment (IDE) for .NET and C++ developers. It includes a complete set of tools for building, debugging, testing, and deploying applications for Windows, web, cloud, and mobile platforms.

A cloud-based development environment that provides a complete VS Code experience in the browser. It allows developers to develop from anywhere, on any device, with fully configured environments that spin up in seconds.

A component of Microsoft Windows that provides the ability to schedule the launch of programs or scripts at pre-defined times or after specified time intervals. It is commonly used for basic automation of administrative tasks.

A community-driven, minimal installer for Conda, pre-configured to use the conda-forge channel. It provides a lightweight way to manage packages and environments for Python and R, particularly useful for data science and machine learning workflows.

A Python package for the creation, manipulation, and study of the structure, dynamics, and functions of complex networks. It is used to analyze graph data, visualize networks, and implement standard graph algorithms.

A JavaScript runtime built on Chrome's V8 JavaScript engine. It uses an event-driven, non-blocking I/O model that makes it lightweight and efficient, perfect for data-intensive real-time applications that run across distributed devices.

An open-source infrastructure as code tool that allows you to define and provision data center infrastructure using a high-level configuration language. It is a community-driven fork of Terraform, ensuring an open ecosystem for infrastructure management.

A data management and process automation platform specifically designed for SAP. It enables business users to automate complex data creation and collection processes using familiar interfaces like Excel and web forms, improving data quality and operational efficiency.

The Python API for Apache Spark, enabling scalable data processing and analysis on massive datasets. It combines the simplicity of Python with the power of Spark's distributed computing engine, making it a go-to tool for big data engineering and machine learning pipelines.

A versatile, high-level programming language known for its readability and vast ecosystem of libraries. It is the dominant language in data science, machine learning, and artificial intelligence, supporting everything from simple scripts to complex deep learning applications.

A professional, user-friendly, open-source Geographic Information System (GIS) application. It allows users to visualize, manage, edit, analyze, and compose printable maps, supporting a wide range of vector, raster, and database formats.

An end-to-end data integration and analytics platform powered by an associative analytics engine. It allows users to explore data freely in any direction, uncovering hidden insights that query-based tools might miss, with strong capabilities for dashboards and self-service BI.

A programming language and software environment specifically designed for statistical computing and graphics. It is widely used by statisticians and data miners for developing statistical software and data analysis, offering powerful tools for modeling, testing, and visualization.

A single solution for business intelligence, enterprise planning, and augmented analytics. Built on the SAP Business Technology Platform, it uses machine learning to uncover insights, simulate scenarios, and drive collaborative decision-making across the organization.

An enterprise data warehousing solution that consolidates data from SAP and non-SAP sources. It provides a reliable "single version of the truth" for reporting and analysis, supporting high-volume data processing and complex modeling requirements.

The legacy graphical user interface client for accessing SAP functionality on a desktop. It provides the front-end interface for users to execute transactions, run reports, and manage administrative tasks within the SAP ERP environment.

The first comprehensive AI for CRM, embedded directly into the Salesforce platform. It delivers AI-powered predictions, recommendations, and automation to sales, service, and marketing teams, helping them work smarter and personalize customer experiences.

A unified platform for integration, APIs, and automation. It allows organizations to connect data, applications, and devices across on-premises and cloud environments, enabling faster delivery of connected experiences.

A high-level programming language that combines object-oriented and functional programming. It is highly scalable and widely used in big data processing frameworks like Apache Spark due to its conciseness and strong static typing.

Provides standards-based connectivity (ODBC, JDBC) to data sources. It ensures that various analytics and BI tools can seamlessly connect to and query data from a wide range of databases and applications without compatibility issues.

A library focused on building lightweight, efficient AI agents. It aims to simplify the development of autonomous systems that can perform tasks by interacting with other software and APIs, emphasizing minimal overhead.

A platform for monitoring data quality and reliability. It helps data teams detect, resolve, and prevent data issues by providing automated checks, alerts, and health dashboards, ensuring trust in the data used for analytics.

A platform for searching, monitoring, and analyzing machine-generated big data via a web-style interface. It is widely used for security information and event management (SIEM), IT operations monitoring, and log analysis.

Structured Query Language is the standard programming language for managing and manipulating relational databases. It is essential for querying, updating, and managing data, forming the backbone of most data analysis and reporting tasks.

An enterprise robotic process automation (RPA) software that provides a digital workforce to automate complex, end-to-end operational activities. It enables organizations to automate repetitive tasks with high security and scalability.

A powerful scientific environment written in Python, for Python, and designed by and for scientists, engineers, and data analysts. It offers a unique combination of advanced editing, analysis, debugging, and profiling functionality of a comprehensive development tool.

An editor for tabular models (Power BI and Analysis Services) that provides an intuitive and efficient way to manipulate measures, calculated columns, and display folders. It offers advanced features like scripting and best practice analysis not found in standard tools.

A component for SQL Server Integration Services (SSIS) that allows for the extraction of mass data from SAP systems. It enables seamless integration of SAP data into SQL Server environments for BI and analytics purposes.

A search-driven analytics platform that enables users to search their data using natural language queries and get instant answers. It empowers non-technical users to create their own reports and dashboards without relying on data analysts.

A database management and development toolset that enables developers and DBAs to reduce time and effort spent on daily tasks. It provides features for SQL optimization, schema management, and database administration.

A modern, Rust-based terminal reimagined with AI built-in. It allows developers to input natural language to generate commands, share workflows, and navigate through terminal output more effectively than traditional command-line interfaces.

A human-readable data serialization standard that can be used in conjunction with all programming languages. It is often used for configuration files and in applications where data is being stored or transmitted.
